column4: I am trying to emigrate from debian to ubuntu. I am using Unetbootin, how do I know that my usb stick is slash dev slash something or something?
plug it in and type mount
or plug it in and type sudo fdisk -l
it's the normal behaviour - what goes wrong? is it wifi?
There is 3 GNOME options, none of them says GNOME Shell
try the one that wasnt there before you installed gnome shell
you mentioned both gnome shell and fallback mode
maybe my hardware doesn't support it, how can I know?
what three options do you see?
logout and watch, 'something like that' is not valid
GNOME, GNOME Classic, GNOME Classic (No effects)        I've choosen GNOME Classic now, and I am thinking in sticking with it
nice, but got to go now, cheers
